events.message: The insured reported a car accident that occurred on the morning of April 9th involving rear-end collision with another vehicle at a red light.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident based on the details of the vehicle collision described by the customer.
An agent specializing in vehicle accident claims was assigned to manage the customer's case and contact the insured.
The customer received confirmation acknowledging the receipt of the auto accident claim and was informed of next steps in the process.
The agent requested additional documents including photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and repair estimates to proceed with the investigation.
Customer submitted all requested documents promptly, providing clear images of damage along with the official police accident report.
Investigation into the claim began to verify the details of the auto collision and to assess liability as well as damage extent.
The investigation was concluded confirming the insured was not at fault, and that the submitted documents and reports were consistent.
A settlement proposal covering the necessary vehicle repairs and rental car expenses was sent to the insured for review and approval.
The insured responded positively, indicating satisfaction with the settlement offer and expressing appreciation for the timely handling.
The claim was officially approved based on the customer's acceptance of the proposed settlement and compliance with policy terms.
Payment covering the vehicle repair costs and additional fees was issued and confirmation sent to the customer's preferred payment method.
Following payment completion and customer satisfaction, the auto accident claim was formally closed in the system without any pending actions.
